It looks like this post will be the second for the day, just because i made the first one after midnight last night..... yeah today, i went to bible school again, where i discovered that an alarming number of young children have purple shirts.... dad showed up and my mom, grandma, and i proceeded to lunch......then, i went to dad's office, and did some stuff for him, like, packing models to ship off to utah, and cleaning rooms, super exciting stuff; oh, and my dad got mad at his new x-ray machine so he took a part off of it and was happy........ later, came home and managed to fall asleep on three different couches; that was pretty cool...... then it rained..... a lot..... then some other stuff happened, and is in the process of happening....... yay

What a day...... sorta so, i went to bible school to help my mom with the crazy three-year-olds.... awww, little abby is so cute, lovingly biting my hand....... then went with mom and grandma to "the store" for lunch...... then came home to find a snake in our garage, the details are kinda boring, but it got away..... freaky stuff, there.......... then i read harry potter until it was time to go to dr. pratt's office; i got a bitch of a retainer, and it looks like i'm getting my wisdom teeth out pretty damn soon.... boo...... then came back home, read harry potter, ate dinner, and then, finally, FINISHED harry potter numba five, just a matter of minutes ago; the novel makes the real world look very dull; i can't believe it took me five days to finish it, i think it took me two days read number 4, but hey, i've been busy...... so now i can have a harry potter free day tomorrow.... hmmm..... ok....... that's all for today.....
i'm kinda tired.... went to bible school this morning, read harry potter this afternoon. not much else to say really. just thought i'd make a post for the sake of making a post.

wow, i missed a day for the first time since i started this blog; please forgive me yesterday, i went to church, then went to my grandma's for lunch, to which we invited my great-uncle (one cool cat) to eat with us..... then i helped my mom set up for bible school, but before that we tried (to no avail) to move a huge table out of the room she wanted, after struggling for several minutes; dialog: Mom: "At least no one's here to see us" Me: "God is here; and he's definately laughing at us" then came home and read harry potter today, i went to Cooks Point United Methodist Church's Vacation Bible School. i hate getting up at 7...... and then i hate driving all the way out there...... my mom's class had 4 kiddos, which i helped control, i guess it went okay; it was just in the morning, and nothing can be extraordinarily fun on a summer's morning; after that mess was over, we took grandmother to the cooks point store (a fine dining establishment), an hour later we were on our way home, where this afternoon i read harry potter and some driver's ed shit (horse shit), humm.... then we had something for dinner here... oh yeah, spaghetti (ooooh, i spelled it right on the first try). so anyways, i hope that everyone has a great week, because i know that i will with hannah, levi, abby, and trevor.........

today was pleasantly boring. i finished the fourth harry potter book, then immediately started the new fifth one, which i discreetly bought this morning at kroger. i read an article about how people waited in endless lines to get the book, when i only waited behind one person at the checkout, hell, i even had a little conveyor belt to put the book on...... so that was most of my day; reading i kinda skipped supper because my parents went to a gospel concert at wolf pen, so i had some chips and a slice of pizza a few minutes ago..... that was pretty good well, that's enough

I finally get a somewhat relaxing day...somewhat............ i woke up at, like, 11:30, which was very nice, then had a sandwich for lunch, i guess i read harry potter most of the afternoon.... the fourth book, just to kinda refresh what the hell is going on in that series so i can buy the fifth book sometime tomorrow, or so........ later dad came home and we tried to make my car smell better because it smelled like perfume shit when we got it..... we sprayed some clorox stuff into the intake for the air conditioner and dad cut his finger on the fan... haha. then we drove around in it some, yeah...... then i mowed the backyard, it was rather warm this afternoon.. i'm tired of typing, the rest of the day was boring .......... end

And NM has some stupid rule where there are signs indicating if you can pass or not... I believe that is what the stripes are for... And the mountain roads are all narrow and curvy. Just blow up the mountains and make land to grow soy beans on. III. Body paragraph 2: Topic: There are a lot of oil wells in West Texas. IV: Body paragraph 3: um....... how bout I just forget this "outline" thing and just type normally, because I forgot the other funny things that I was going to put here... So I thought to myself... I should make a blog entry, and so... here goes: I got up at like, 8:30 (early), and mowed the front yard. About ten minutes after I was done, a lot of water started falling from the sky. This water cancelled my lunch date with my dear, sweet Granny. So instead I went to Arby's. Then, in the afternoon, lots of little things happened. One of mother's teacher friends brought a friend over to see how our house was decorated. I went to the post office. I later went out to grandmother's and helped her figure out her pill crusher, and also fixed her TV (by changing the channel, and hitting the Wireless One box). Then, I came back home. Not much later, my dad came home and proclaimed "I forgot the damn gold." I went to FedEx for him to send teeth to Utah, while he went to get said "damn gold" so that he could cast a crown for a dental student. This was an interesting process. He melted the gold with a blowtorch to a temperature of like, 1000+ degrees. Then set the mold next to it, and let the gizmo spin the molten gold into the mold (rhyme!). Then they left and we went to eat at Fazoli's. Then I went to my dad's office and Wal-Mart. Tomorrow, I am leaving for New Mexico. I'll be back Tuesday some time. I really have no idea what we're doing out there; we're just... going. I think we're going to see horse races, though. It should be fun anyways. I hope you readers don't miss me too much.
No one cares what I did today, so I won't write about what I did today. Also, I did very little today. ha!

Hmmm....................... Today, I went to The Theatre Company's production of Annie Get your Gun , not long after I woke up. It was very good. Then, my family and I went to the new Wings on University. It was okay, but I wasn't hungry enough to eat the several metric tonnes of french fries buried beneath my fried chicken. Then, we returned home, and I immediately left with my dad to do crap at his office. Crap like, washing the windows out front. And somehow, my dad managed to get the water to a temperature probably mere degrees below boiling, however, he failed to mention this to me, and I almost kicked the water all over the place when I stuck my hand in. It was like a plate at a Mexican food place; you have to wonder why it's so damn hot. Then I came home and watched Analyze This on CBS. Now I'm on the computer as I am every night... What a day!

Well, as it turns out I did go to the concert thing. The band was called "Big Otis." Big Otis is a big black man; he was very cool; he sang old songs and stuff. The black audience danced, while the lesser-priveleged white people expressed their enjoyment of the music in other manners. At one point in the evening, Big Otis called a fifty- or sixty-something lady up to the stage, who, quite possibly, out-funked Big Otis with her dance groove; everybody enjoyed a good laugh at that one. About 3,000 people were in attendance this evening, pretty cool. Props to the College Station Utility Department for putting this series on. Have a good evening everyone.

What DID I do today?? hmmm.... oh, okay My mother got me up around noon, and sent me to pick up some lunch. After we ate, I took my dad's sandwich to him at his office, where he was showing one of the oral surgeon's sons how to cast a crown (fun). Then, (after arguing with my mother) I helped clean house. This evening, they went to a wedding, in which both the bride and groom have Down syndrome. You may have seen the bride (Wendy) working at Chick-fil-a. While they are at that, I stayed at home and did nothing (read: wrote blog entry). Actually, I did make myself supper, which consisted of: wheat crackers, cheese, peanut butter, and sour cream and onion potato chips. At one point, I put all four together and dipped it in some ranch dressing I found. To answer the obvious question, it tasted like a wheat cracker, cheese, peanut butter, and sour cream and onion potato chips dipped in ranch. Later this evening there is a free concert at Wolf Pen Amphitheater, which I might or might not go to. Some people will be there that I know, and my parents might go if they get back in time. Well, that's not until later so I won't worry about it.

Today was an odd day, actually. I woke up around 9:30, and my mom was trying to get me to mow the yard, but I didn't want to. However, I lost that argument as I lose all arguments that happen while I am still in bed. So, I mowed the front, and my mom came out with a trash bag and picked through the flowerbeds, and a bag later it looked no different from the street than it had before. Then I had lunch and mowed the back, almost running over a snake that I hadn't seen for about a month.... boooo.. Then, I guess I worked on the computer, trying, to no avail, to make the video capture card work. Oh well, at least I got the CD burning software working, so I don't have to use stupid Windows Media Player. This evening, a friend of my family came over and showed us that she was getting married, and at the same time, my cousin came over with her husband and their dog, to let Sadie get aquainted with her. So, at one point, there were six people and two dogs in our living room. That was fun, though. Later, my dad came back from a meeting in San Antonio. So this evening, I've done nothing. Now, I'm listening to a newly burned CD of a motley selection of music. My day was actually more exciting and humorous than how I wrote about it, but I don't feel like putting a humorous flair into today's blog. Although........ when I went to pick up a prescription, the pharmacist asked how my summer was; I said fine, and she asked if I'd been to any nude beaches in the Riviera, and I said no, and she said, "Well, then it can't be going that good." Funny lady....
I did nothing today.

Woah, yesterday's entry was harsh... sorry bout that Today was pretty boring, except for going to lunch with my grandmother. She was very, very excited to have me taking her to lunch. We also went to my grandfather's grave and changed the flowers, and went by one of my grandma's friends to pay her back some money. I also cut a watermelon for her (and threw the rind over the fence, very fun), and helped her with her pill crusher. As I said, she was very excited. Then I've been at home the rest of the day, doing nothing. I watched Jaws all the way through for the first time, although I think I've seen the entire movie, broken up. That is a very funny movie. I sent an e-mail to myself from my cell phone; it said "Hello." That probably cost, like, 30 cents, stupid Cingular. STUPID HIGH SCHOOL COUNSELORS! Trying to kill me. I'm sure of it. Have a lovely day, everyone!

oh. yeah. today is my birthday. yay! hi, I just got back from a 5-day vacation in the super cool city of Ft. Worth, Texas. I went urlLink here and urlLink here and urlLink here . Additionally, I attended a meeting of retired federal employees; that was a lot of fun. It was essentially a meeting for some old people to catch up with each other's lives over the past month and get a good meal. A lady talked about how her hearing aid got run over at the last meeting, and another complained jokingly that they couldn't afford to send a ragweed to the people in their organization who died. At the age of 60, I believe my aunt was the youngest member of this fine organization, which meets at a conference room at Weatherford College. Very amusing. I also put up with my bratty cousin, Austin, who claims to be six-quarters because he doesn't understand fractions...... I went to a baseball game, and hung out with my now 31-year-old cousin, Mark, and his wife, who is pregnant with a boy. But I think the highlight of the trip was our visit to the Petroleum Club. After a fancy dinner there, my cousin and I both received rather large birthday cakes with bright sparklers shooting flames/sparks at least a foot into the air. They boxed up the cakes, since dinner included a dessert, and when we got home we found that the cake had been boxed with a Petroleum Club china plate underneath it. I guess they'll be short two plates when they do inventory. Also went to the Central Market in Ft. Worth. It wasn't all that impressive. weeeeeeeeeee........... I think I'll go to TCU, just so I can live in Ft. Worth, yeah....... yeah........ that'd be great....... oh, and while I was on my aunt's computer, I looked at my blog in Netscape, and it looked awful...... so if you have Netscape, you can just go fly a kite, or something or something

Hello everyone. I'm in Ft. Worth having a grand old time. I'm on my aunt's laptop, which sucks for typing, so I'll just make a big post later on my cool keyboard back at home. Well, just wanted to let the masses know that I'm still alive, and will be back Friday evening. Adios, amigos!

hello friends and neighbors. nothing happened today until whenever we left for a 4th of July party. we left the house, and everyone was in a horrible mood. then we got to the pasture where the party was, and people were fishing in the tank and sitting around and stuff. some guy caught a 6 pound catfish, that was pretty cool. then we ate 4th of July type food. then the little kids shot fireworks. later, some guys arrived from delivering a stillborn calf, and they recounted their story to everyone........hmmm. so now i'm sitting here, we have another 4th party tomorrow, along with bigger fire works....... yay

Today blowed. Actually, I think the lady on the Midday Magazine television program said that the winds today were "light and variable," meaning today blowed gently........hahahhahahahahhahahahahahhahahahaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa ha But seriously, nothing happened, until maybe, like, 6:00, or so at that time, all of the mammals in the house piled into the little car and went over the river and through some trees to grandmother's house we went. there, we visited with my aunt, and discussed when i will be visiting her and her clan in Ft. Worth (July 5-10). then sadie and i walked through the pasture. then we came home, where i have been speeding the rotting of my brain by sitting fruitlessly in front of the computer. au revoir

Today is the middle day of the year, and I heard somewhere that it was declared something like, forget every thing that has happened so far this year and start anew. Well, that sounds good. Right now I'm watching the Henman-Grosjean match on ESPN; Henman is losing; that sucks. Tennis is fun to watch. okay............ bye

I guess I'll pick up where I left off...... on Saturday.... Sunday, I drove to Orange, TX and we hung out at the hospital there, with my grandparents. My grandmother isn't recovering well from a triple hernia surgery, and has been in the rehab part of the hospital for almost three weeks. Monday, we went to the hospital, went out to eat at some cajun restraunt, went to my grandparent's house, went to their neighbor's house and talked with that 90+ year-old lady, went back to the hospital, then came home for supper and sleep. Today, we went to the hospital and ate lunch at the cafeteria there (tasty hospital food). Then I drove all the way back home, including a stop in Conroe so that my mom could do some shopping, while I fell asleep in the car. We finally got back home, and I was actually really happy to see Sadie, because my grandparent's rat terrier is an hyperactive little asshole; Sadie, on the other hand, is a sweetie.......... then we went out to eat, and did normal Steck stuff this evening....... it's good to be home

My throat feels slightly better... last night it was killing me. Sometime before Tuesday morning I have to write an English essay and think about writing several history essays for a test that I am sure to do poorly on. I don't think I've left the house this weekend, how sad. I still feel crappy. I still hate school. Thank God for Essay-writing Day, I mean, Labor Day..... hah

I'm sick. My throat feels like shit, along with my head and stomach. I came home Friday afternoon, fell asleep, woke up for a few hours, went to bed at 8:30, woke up at 8 this morning, took a shower and ate breakfast, then went back to sleep until 11. Our El Paso friends are coming here (again), and are supposed to be here at about 2. This sucks...

Today was really boring. I woke up late. Had a cinnamon roll for breakfast. Waited for the Sitters to show up for lunch, but they didn't. So we ate at about 2. Hmmm, then, I went to Barnes and Noble and looked around for a long while, then finally got what I needed and left. I wrote my English crap, and then sat around for a while. For supper, we got brisket from Rudy's and ate at home with the Sitters. I still have Stats homework, and have to read a chapter for history. That sucks because it's like, 11 o'clock. Devin made a lot of comments about Mormons, etc. It's funny. Read.

Today I woke up late (noon), and helped clean house, and bathed the dog, and practiced baritone and sat around. Around 7, the Sitters arrived from El Paso. Their son is will be a fish at A&M, and he moves into his dorm tomorrow. In the meantime, he and his parents are staying with us. We took them to Freebird's for supper, and then drove around campus for almost half an hour. Then we came home, and the parents talked while Drew and I went to our separate rooms and watched tv or whatever. I don't talk much to Drew, oh well. I might actually have to get up early tomorrow to do stuff. I know I need to start homework. I have an idea for my 25-line autobio. It should be good. I smell coffee......

Hmmmm... it rained last night. A lot. School was fantastic. Hooray school. My pre-cal class is a large collection of people who have no idea what they are doing. They make this very obvious to the other 30 or so members of the class by saying things like, "I don't know what I'm doing" or "Can I copy your answers?"... oh well. The rockathon was dumb. Beano had something very large (Mr. Dixon) stuck up his ass.... seriously. Oh well, sucks to his ass-mar. Tomorrow, some El Pasoans are coming and spending a night or two at our house. bah! I have developed a general disliking for all of my teachers, except maybe Mr. Mac.... Mrs. Schultz, along with most English teachers, is just plain weird. I was putting together my "writing handbook," when I realized that it was the dumbest thing ever. Putting that together wasn't as bad as making 10 drill books, but at least drill books have a purpose. I ended up doing a really shitty job, oh well. Coach Pryor is cool, but he is a coach, and he teaches like a coach. He's on my not-so-bad list. Coach Sanders pissed me off today. We were assigned the first half of chapter 2, which I read, but the quiz today ended up being over most of the second half of the chapter, which most everyone else read. I did nothing in programming; I finished all my stuff. Mrs. Rister is on my not-so-bad list as well, but she doesn't know much of what she's talking about. Band is still mildly annoying. Mrs. Hobbs is interesting, so is that class. I do very little in there. It's odd. Mrs. Walker is also on said list, but, well, whatever, it's physics. blah. Band today was worthless. Dixon is a whiner. I started homework earlier today, and also finished earlier. I find that amazing. The finishing earlier allowed me time to make this post; I didn't have time last night because I was up until midnight or so reading. But that's what happens when I start school shit at 9 or so. At the end of last year, I was more than ready for school to be out. I can't help but having that same feeling at the beginning of this year.

Aghh, such a loooooong day! I actually had homework today, but I didn't do my pre-cal, all two questions of it. I'm glad I'm already in the habit of not doing my math homework; just like last year. I did do my stats homework, and read for history. The history textbook is quite readable; I think that's very good. Um, what else... I went to walmart to get crap for school. I think that store only gets busier as it gets later. At 9:30, it's freakin' packed, and at 10 it's a veritable zoo of people (like me) getting in his or her discount shopping. I also talked with Mrs. Pustay this afternoon; she is the coolest teacher in the school. Spongebab.......hahahhahahaha

Oh no! I didn't make a post yesterday... but that's because we were setting up our new wireless network, and the computers were kinda tied up. And also because I went to bed a little earlier than usual on account of SCHOOL!!!!! So, school started today; it was okay, I guess. I'm pretty sure I'm going to die with my magnificent course load. Mrs. Schultz is an eccentric lady. I don't feel like typing about my other teachers; they are losers. I'm not so much tired as I'm just in a bad mood. School sucks and band is getting annoying. Oh well, so goes my life.

Let's see... this morning I almost woke up when my dog started barking, but I turned over and went back to sleep. It turns out she was barking at some Mormons that came to our door. I had a sandwich for lunch. Then went to Office Depot and Max for school supply stuff. I bought some stuff, like, a new calculator. It has the periodic table in German and Spanish on it. I think that is stupid. This afternoon was uneventful. My dad grilled steaks and stuff for supper; that was good. I'm tired from all of the day's inactivities. See ya later.

Today was a bitch. I woke up at 5:30, showered, and picked up my littles to go to breakfast. That went pretty smoothly. Then band occured, blah. I think that baritone section time now equals talk about sex time, oh well, fine by me. Kelly was tremendously funny. He got paid to run through sections and start riverdancing... funny stuff. For lunch I was supposed to meet my cousin and her friends at Cheddar's, but band got out late, and it took me half an hour to drive there. I think that's what pissed me off the most today, the traffic. So I drove thru Whataburger and took it to my mom's school and ate it while watching tv and waiting for my mom. As it turns out, she was eating inside Whataburger at the same time I was there. Oh well. So then, from about 1:30 to 5:00 I worked in my mom's room... super boring, but I don't really mind. It's like my duty as teacher's child to do stuff like that. I left quickly to avoid being grabbed by another teacher and assigned a task. After everyone was home, we went to the Bryan post office to mail taxes (they are only due April 15 if you don't file for an extension of time like my procrastinating father). The family was in a pretty bad mood by then, so we were going to go to Cotton Patch, but it had a long wait. So we went to Freebird's, instead. I believe this is the third time I've been there without using my gift certificates that are sitting on my desk. Oh well. Then we came home, and I watched the Astros lose. Oh well, again. It's Friday night, and I'm at home doing nothing. yay me! Oh well.

*yawn* today was very.... something... It rained this morning at band. The baritone sectional was nothing but idle chatting, about gay rights, religion, and John Tell (not necessarily at once). I went to lunch with a multitude of people to Wings. Rob started crying. Good times. After a while at home, I left for my mom's school where I helped until Meet the Teacher Night started at about five. Later this evening, I picked up my yearbook. I've looked through it some; it's moderately disappointing, since it's merely last year's book with different people, and in full color... oh well, not a bad job overall. I did some junk for my mom, like stacking papers that the kids have to fill out. School is about to start, and I'm not ready for it. Go to hell, school.

OOOOOokay... morning always equals band... For lunch, I came home and ate left over pizza and showered. Then, I went to Rob's to give away the music stand I had been offering. From there, I went to Dr. Pratt's office, where he looked in my mouth and told his assistant to make another appointment for January. Then, I came home, and at about five my dad called me to his office so that I could jump start his truck. Then, I followed him to the car-fixing joint so I could drive him home. For supper, we went to Mi Cocina. It was good, as usual. This evening, I took the dog for a walk, and helped my mom with getting-ready-for-school stuff. Yay for my new blog title; yay for people who make comments... haha

It's tough to write a blog entry after reading op-eds from The New York Times , but here goes... Band was this morning: it was really cold and windy. Kristen thought that the practice was going horribly at the first water break... that was really funny. I went to lunch with Rob and Mark, then came home for a while, then went to walmart to get a birthday present for Sloan, then I went to the post office and mailed it. Then, I came home for another while, until Rob picked me up to go to the MSC and play DDR. I think DDR would be more fun if I had been playing it for however long Rob, et al. have been playing it. Today was the first time I had played it, and I figured out that it works better if I actually try. hah! Then, I came home and my family went to Jason's Deli, which I thought I had talked my family out of going to, many years ago... oh well; it was okay. Then, I came home and watched most of the Astros game, which they probably lost. If you read every single word of this post, you are likely a very bored person. If you wrote every single word of this post, then you are definately a bored person. haha... Also, it seems that my comment service has been intermittent in functioning. So if you feel a dire need to make a comment, and the link isn't there, just try back later. I don't know what's going on, but I won't complain since the thing is free.

Today was really, really boring. My cousin and her husband brought their dog over. She has spent the day with us, and will be here most of tomorrow. She's a black lab... very sweet. It was hot this morning. At lunch, I went to Pebble Creek; we all got very "close" on the bus... This afternoon was full band with Dixon... I left as fast as I could at 4:00, and was home the earliest I've been so far this week. Then I took a nap until we went to Frittella for dinner. We met a dentist friend of my dad's... it was good. Then I came home and watched "Whose Line." It is a great show... Well, adios.

Today was faaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaannnntastic. This morning was band. Poor Mac lost it. It was really really hot. I actually didn't mind the heat, or the screaming director, or the repetitive processes. I think that would be considered odd, but I was actually in a very good mood at 11:30. Then I went to lunch with John. We went to the Freebirds in Northgate, and then proceeded to buy drum major gloves, oak leaves, and my captain's bars. Then, the afternoon was band. I only stayed at the band hall until five o'clock today. Then, I came home, showered, and went back to the school for registration. This whole process rather pissed me off. I'm not really sure why, though. I think it's because I don't want to go to school. And also because I saw Ms. Lange... My schedule is in my info. The persons involved in the fiasco of moving me from Chem 2 to Physics pre-AP should be damned to hell, in my humble opinion. I was going to ask the schedule problem lady about programming and wind symphony being the same period, but that lady is a bitch, and I might not even make wind symphony. And I don't want my damn textbooks! I shouldn't have to even see them until, at earliest, the second day of school. At least the parking tag is cool... sorta. In conclusion, I think the registration and an e-mail from big Jason, telling me that he hated band and was sad in Austin, turned awry my excellent day. Well, I'll see you guys later.

I'm almost too tired to write this, but I'm doing it anyways... I woke up at, like, 5:30 this morning and tried to go back to sleep until I finally got up around 7. Then I went to band... the water balloon "fight" was a pleasant surprise. Then, I went to lunch with Mark and Erin. Then, went home and watered a plant... yeah... Then did the afternoon band thing, and stayed until about 6 so I could teach a freshman how to march, and help Mark and Erin with his drill books. Erin and I ended up leaving after Mac did... that's kinda sad. I went home, changed clothes, and went to Olive Garden with my parents, since it was their anniversary. Somehow, I ended up driving, and since we couldn't decide where to go, I threatened to take them to Dairy Queen. That would've been awesome. We did end up going to Wal-Mart after that, though, to get string (clothesline) for drill books and some other stuff. Then, I walked the dog, took a shower, did some junk and got on the computer. what a day! If you are reading this, make a comment... about anything...

Morning: Band Lunch: Home Afternoon: Band... then, Dad's office, bank, haircut place Evening: Home... working on DRILL BOOKS Night: Hopefully, a very restful sleep As you can tell, today was very boring, indeed. Mr. Rabinowitz made me do push ups because Brynn played in a rest. How fair. Tomorrow looks like another dandy day. Take care.

This morning I did band stuff, and this evening I worked on drill books. Making drill books is torture compared to summer band. My mom and I worked for two hours, and I still have to punch holes in the pages and highlight each person's letter. You will love drill books; they are great. If you disagree, I will bitch slap you. Good night.

I like blogging... it's so easy, and it gives me the false impression that someone might want to know what I did on any given day. When I started I learnt myself some html and whipped up a template, but now all I have to do is type an entry and click a button. I think that's how it's supposed to work... Today, I woke up at noon, and had a kolache for breakfast, then read the paper... The Eagle had a blurb that I found very amusing... it pertained to high school hazing and initiations, and sited Mrs. Hester as a source, and specifically mentioned band, although not for a bad reason. We grilled chicken for supper; it was good. This evening I went with my dad to his office; that was actually quite hilarious for reasons that are difficult to explain. Well, now the day has ended. Good night.

this entry is rather incoherent: It seems like I had some idea for an entry, but I forgot it. umm.... same old, same old, yeah... football game tomorrow, that's cool what's with all this dumb english homework? and why does mrs. schultz have to come to first period ONLY (my period) everyday, instead of staying at home like any normal person would? SCREW YOU, STATISTICS!!! Oh man, Mrs. Schultz made tea for the whole class; it was awesome. I heard that she fell and hurt her wrist pretty badly after second period. I wanted to tell those parents that their child was deathly afraid of them, but that would have been improper decorum. Ok, end rant... Wow, today was so awesome!!! I got my English test back... 73. So, for the moment (and possibly forever), Mrs. Schultz is firmly on my "teachers I don't like" list. She is in love with the eight-sentence format, and barely even encourages us to deviate from it. She gave us a copy of Nisha Rathore's responses, which received a 100 and were written in a tedious, wordy, and highly repetitive style. (I'm not hating on Nisha. She's a good person... I think.) The Rice game was great fun. Apparently, they lost, but we left early, when they were winning. The urlLink Marching Owl Band is absolutely hilarious. Their halftime show for today was backwards-themed. They made fun of what Tulsa spells backwards, and played their signature "Louie, Louie" exit at the beginning of the show. The band announcer also announced the homecoming court for 3002: the queen was "Esther" and princess was some guy's beard. They also said Rice was where the university gave money to alumni, and students drank in class and slept at parties. After we left, we drove around Rice's beautiful campus and the medical center area. Then we came home; the end.

So, today was beat/out-black Bryan day. And I think we did that, with Sam yelling foodstuffs the entire bus ride. haha.... Tomorrow, I'm going to the Rice/Tulsa game; that should be fun. I hope it's a little warmer than it was tonight though. (This is a note to myself to show Jason the picture of his cousin in The Roar.) Have a good weekend.
